title: Welcome To The Black Parade
lyrics:
[intro, kazoo] | (F) (C) | (Bb) (F) | (Gm) (Dm) | (Gm) (C) |
 
When (F)I was a (C)young boy,
My (Dm)father took (F)me into the (Gm)city
To see a marching (Bb)band (C)
He said, (F)"Son, when you (C)grow up
Would (Dm)you be the (F)savior of the (Gm)broken
The beaten, and the (Bb)damned?" (C)
He said, (F)"Will you de(C)feat them
Your (Dm)demons and (F)all the non-belie(Gm)vers?
The plans that they have (Bb)made? (C)
Because (F)"one day, I'll (C)leave you
A (Dm)phantom to (F)lead you in the sum(Gm)mer
To join the black pa(Bb)rade" (C)
 
[instrumental]  | (F) (C) | (Dm) (Dm) | (Bb) (F) | (Dm) (C) |
 
When (F)I was a (C)young boy,
My (Dm)father took (F)me into the (Gm)city
To (Bb)see a marching (Bb)band (C)
He said, (F)"Son, when you (C)grow up
Would (Dm)you be the (F)savior of the (Gm)broken
The (Bb)beaten, and the (Bb)damned?" (C)
 
[kazoo, instrumental] |(F) (C) | (Dm) (Dm) | (Bb)        |
[single downstrums]  |(Dm-Dm-Bb-C) |
 
Some(F)times I get the feelin', She's (Dm)watchin' over (Bb)me
And (Gm)other times I (Bb)feel like I should (C)go      
When (F)through it all, the rise and fall, the (Dm)bodies in the (Bb)streets
And (Gm)when you're gone, we (Bb)want you all to (C)know
 
[chorus]
(N/C) We'll carry (F)on,
we'll (C)carry (Dm)on
And though you are (Bb)dead and gone, be(F)lieve me
Your (Bb)memory will (C)carry (F)on,
We'll (C)carry (Dm)on
And though you’re in my (Bb)heart, I can't con(F)tain it
The (Gm)anthem won't ex(C)plain it
 
A (F)world that sends you reeling, from (Dm)decimated (Bb)dreams
Your (Gm)misery and (Bb)hate will kill us (C)all
So (F)paint it black and take it back, let's (Dm)shout it loud and clear
De(Bb)fiant to the end, we hear the (C)call
 
[chorus]
To carry (F)on,
We'll (C)carry (Dm)on
And though you are (Bb)dead and gone, be(F)lieve me
Your (Bb)memory will (C)carry (F)on,
We'll (C)carry (Dm)on
And though we are (Bb)broken and de(F)feated
Your (Gm)weary widow (C)marches
 
[bridge]
(A)On and on, we carry through the (Dm)fears (Oh, oh, oh)
(A)Disappointed faces of your (Dm)peers (Oh, oh, oh)
(Bb)Take a look at me, 'Cause I (Bbm)could not care at all
 
[slower strum/double time]
(F) Do or die, (C) you'll never make me
(Dm) Because the world (Bb) will never take my (F)heart
Go and try, (C) you'll never break me
(Dm) We want it all, (Bb) we wanna play this (F)part
I won't explain (C) or say I'm sorry
(Dm) I'm unashamed, (Bb) I'm gonna show my (F)scars
Give a cheer (C) for all the broken
(Dm) Listen here, (Bb) because it's who we are
[upkey - G]
(G) I'm just a man, (D) I'm not a hero
(Em) Just a boy, (C) who had to sing this song
(G) I'm just a man, (D) I'm not a hero
(F)I….. don't…. (D) care…
 
[rock beat]
(N/C) We'll carry (G)on
We'll (D)carry (Em)on
And though you are (C)dead and gone, believe (G) me
Your (C)memory will (D)carry (G)on
You'll (D)carry (Em)on
And though you are (C)broken and de(G)feated
Your (Em)weary widow (D)marches on
 
[slower strum/double time]
(G) Do or die, (D) you'll never make me
(Em) Because the world (C) will never take my (G)heart
Go and try, (D) you'll never break me
(Em) We want it all, (C) we wanna play this part (we'll carry on)
 
[again]
(G) Do or die, (D) you'll never make me
(Em) Because the world (C) will never take my (G)heart
Go and try, (D) you'll never break me
(Em) We want it all, (C) we wanna play this part (we'll carry on)
 
[outro, slow down…]
(A) (A) (G-single strum) |  We'll (D)carry (G)on! [end]
